text: John Higgins (born 18 May 1975) is a Scottish professional snooker player. He has won the World Championship four times. He has also lost in the final four times. In the modern snooker era only Stephen Hendry, Steve Davis, Ray Reardon and Ronnie O'Sullivan have been world champion more often. John Higgins started his professional career in 1992. He was banned in 2010 because of a betting scandal, but successfully returned to the World Snooker Tour afterwards. == Other websites == * John Higgins at snooker.org Category:1975 births Category:Living people Category:British snooker players Category:Sportspeople from North Lanarkshire
title: John Higgins
